availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jefferson Dawson, Sr. (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Rice Dawson in Bath County, Kentucky, in November 1846. Father of Mary P. Dawson, John W. Dawson, Nancy Dawson, Joseph Dawson, Emma Dawson, Jenny Dawson, and Jefferson Dawson, Jr. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Owned James [Unknown] in Bath County in 1858. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 76A.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994028, Bath County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273005.
